basic.description: Throughout the twentieth century, leftists in Canada, socialists, communists, anarchists, feminists, gay and lesbian activists, Greens, and others have struggled to reshape Canadian society and politics. This course traces their attempts to transform Canada by examining distinct periods and frameworks of analysis, concluding with the challenge of globalization.
basic.subject: HIST
basic.title: The Canadian Left in the Twentieth Century

extra.enrollment_requirement: PREREQUISITE    A Grade of C+ in 6.0 units from HIST 300-329 and registration in a HIST Major or Medial Plan.
